page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN SHIPSTON
page.content: Shipston was on a{stage-coach}route and three one-time coaching inns are recognisable today. A horse-drawn{tramway}operated between Stratford-upon-Avon and Moreton-in-Marsh.A branch line from this ran to Shipston. This was later converted to a{railway}line.Passenger services ran until 1929.The nearest railway station today is at Moreton- in-Marsh. When we conducted interviews about public transport,17% of people said they travelled by rail. 74% said there was one{car}in the family,20% of families had more than one car, the rest had no car. 63% felt that{car parking}facilities in Shipston were inadequate,but 14% said facilities were good.
